CompoundIndexOnNestedField.Message: Compound indexes with nested fields are not fully supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. If you are using compound index where the value at the nested fields are docs (not arrays), you may enable the ''EnableUniqueCompoundNestedDocs' capability on your database account. Else, consider switching to Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore.

UniqueIndexOnNestedField.Message: Unique indexes with nested fields are not fully supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. If you are using unique index where the nested fields are docs (not arrays), you may enable the 'EnableUniqueCompoundNestedDocs' capability on your database account. Else, consider switching to Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore.

CompoundIndexLimit.Message: RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB supports a maximum of 8 fields and a total of 2048 characters in all the fields of the index. You would need to reduce the number of fields in the compound index. Compound indexes are only used in queries that sort results by multiple fields. For queries that have multiple filters that don't need to sort, create multiple single field indexes.

UniqueIndex.Message: Unique indexes can only be created on empty collections on RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. Create unique indexes on non-empty collections before data migration.

TextIndex.Message: Text indexes are currently not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. We recommend using Azure AI Search for full text search and advanced search features like wildcard search etc. You need to set up the search indexer. Else, consider switching to Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore.

HashedIndex.Message: Hashed indexes are not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. Hashed indexes are used for sharding in MongoDB, and Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB automatically manages sharding based on your shard key, so they are not needed.

VectorIndex.Message: Vector Index is not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.

TTLIndexOnAbsolutePath.Message: TTL index on a custom path is not enabled by default on RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. Please enable the 'EnableTtlOnCustomPath' capability on your account before migration. Please also note that RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB does not support creating TTL indexes on array of fields. You may only create TTL index on one field per collection.

MultipleTTLIndexesOnDifferentFields.AssessmentName: Multiple TTL Indexes on Different Fields
MultipleTTLIndexesOnDifferentFields.Message: RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB does not support creating multiple TTL indexes. You may only create TTL index on one field per collection.

WildCardProjection.Message: RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB does not support creating wildcard index on multiple single fields by specifying “wildcardProjection" during index creation. You can create multiple single field indexes instead.

PartialIndex.Message: Partial unique index is not enabled by default on RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. Please enable the 'EnablePartialUniqueIndex' capability on your account before migration. Partial indexes which are not unique are not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.

PartialTTLIndex.Message: RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB does not support creating partial TTL indexes.

SparseUniqueTTLIndex.Message: RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB does not support creating sparse unique TTL indexes.

CaseInsensitiveIndex.Message: Case insensitive indexes are not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.

Geospatial2dIndex.Message: Geospatial 2d indexes are not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.

GeoHaystackIndex.Message: GeoHaystack indexes are deprecated and are not supported in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.

SparseIndex.Message: Sparse indexes which are not unique are not required to be sparse in RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. Consider using single field indexes to improve query performance instead.

SparseUniqueIndexOnSingleField.AssessmentName: Sparse Unique Index on Single Field
SparseUniqueIndexOnSingleField.Message: Sparse Unique indexes having single field are not supported with RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB. Consider using partial unique indexes instead.

SparseUniqueIndexOnMultipleFields.AssessmentName: Sparse Unique Index on Multiple Fields
SparseUniqueIndexOnMultipleFields.Message: Sparse Unique indexes having multiple fields are not supported with RU based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.
